Transparency.justification: Score = 1 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: Responsible AI
relevantSources.summary: Comprehensive policy detailing AI transparency, fairness, and accountability framework. Policy establishes transparency requirements for AI solutions.

relevantSources.title: Summary of Policies and Procedures Updated on May 7, 2024
relevantSources.summary: Summary document highlighting responsible AI policy including transparency commitments.

Transparency.findings: HCA Healthcare's Responsible AI policy and summary documents provide concrete evidence of transparency requirements for AI systems, including disclosure of AI use and decision processes. These artifacts show the company has formalized transparency commitments in its AI governance.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.justification: Score = 1 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: Responsible AI
relevantSources.summary: Policy explicitly addresses bias mitigation and fairness requirements for AI solutions.

relevantSources.title: HCA Healthcare Magazine Spring 2024
relevantSources.summary: Magazine discusses health equity initiatives and commitment to fair healthcare delivery.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.findings: The Responsible AI policy and HCA Healthcare's magazine provide detailed evidence of bias mitigation and fairness practices, including explicit requirements for bias assessment and monitoring. These sources confirm organizational action toward equity in both AI and broader healthcare delivery.

relevantSources.title: Responsible AI

relevantSources.title: Technology: the Brave New World of Healthcare

Human Oversight & Accountability.findings: HCA Healthcare provides concrete evidence of human oversight in AI, including policy-mandated review processes and real-world examples of physician oversight in AI deployments. These sources demonstrate both formal and practical mechanisms for accountability in AI use.

Privacy & Security.findings: HCA Healthcare's published policies provide detailed, AI-specific privacy and security requirements, including data protection, GDPR compliance, and patient privacy. These artifacts show the company has established robust privacy and security controls for AI data.

relevantSources.title: Responsible AI

Governance & Accountability.findings: The Responsible AI policy establishes a formal governance structure for AI, including a dedicated council and clear accountability mechanisms. This provides concrete evidence of structured oversight for AI activities at HCA Healthcare.

Public Commitments & External Audits.findings: HCA Healthcare demonstrates public commitments to responsible AI through formal policy requirements for vendors, participation in sector-wide AI commitments, and public reporting on responsible AI governance. These sources provide concrete evidence of external accountability.

summary.overallFindings: HCA Healthcare demonstrates comprehensive responsible AI practices across most pillars, with robust policies and public documentation on transparency, fairness, oversight, privacy, governance, and external commitments. The organization has formalized its approach to responsible AI through detailed internal policies and public-facing reports. However, there is a notable lack of public evidence regarding explainability practices for AI systems. Overall, HCA Healthcare's responsible AI program is mature and well-documented, with explainability representing the primary area for improvement.
